page.title: 08Health in Canterbury
page.content: The main{hospital}in the area is the Kent and Canterbury General Hospital which deals with accidents, acute illnesses and births. For the{mentally ill,}there is St. Augustine's hospital at Chartham. Long term{elderly}women psychiatric patients go to St.Martin's Hospital and there is also a Day Hospital for patients who are about to be discharged from St.Augustine's. The Mary Sheridan Assesment Centre examines children who have learning problems for{physical,}mental, emotional or social reasons. The Pilgrims Hospice looks after the terminally ill and there is also the Chaucer Private Hospital for fee-paying patients. The Health Centre provides services to 67,000 people. Services include clinics,dentistry and family planning.
